page.title: 01INTRO: SUTTON COLDFIELD
page.content: Sutton Coldfield East is a place where{town}meets{country.}The parallel valleys of Plants and Langley brooks are largely{agricultural}or other open space,whilst the central ridge supports private and council{housing} at Reddicap Heath and Falcon Lodge.To the west is the town centre,with shops offices and some houses. Important{constructions}include a hospital,barracks,industrial estate, schools,farms and the A38 by-pass. The by-pass relieved traffic pressure on the crowded town centre, but created a physical barrier up to which development might extend,despite the land's status as{Green Belt.} A housing scheme at New Hall is eating into the farmland.But since the railway{commuting}of the mid 19th Century linked us to Birmingham,our area has been a residential{dormitory.
